title: travelplanner: Could you devise a 7-day travel plan for two people, starting in Las Vegas and touring 3 cities in Idaho from March 4th to March 10th, 2022? Our budget is set at $5,100. We require accommodations that allow smoking and should ideally be entire rooms. We would prefer to avoid any flights for our transportation. (f1bd0bd86c502641)

always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan!

chat_history.name: accommodation_search

chat_history.content:
# A Smoking Tour of Idaho

With your preference to stay in entire rooms and your no-flying policy, I've set out a road trip that will take you from Las Vegas to Idaho Falls, and on to Pocatello and Twin Falls.

## Day 1: Las Vegas
Arrive in Las Vegas and check in to a 'Cozy Modern Stay' for 2 people, priced at $100 per night. Spend the rest of the day exploring the city, perhaps enjoying some of its famous nightlife.

## Day 2: Las Vegas to Idaho Falls (480 miles)
After breakfast, you'll begin the journey to Idaho Falls. Your route will take you past the Great Salt Lake and its surrounding mineral flats, which could be a good spot to stop and take some photos or stretch your legs. Later, you might want to drive through the Caribou-Targhee National Forest until you arrive in Idaho Falls. There, you could stay at the 'Le Ritz Hotel & Suites', which allows smoking and costs $61 per person per night. You'll be in the city centre, so you can easily explore the Museum of Idaho and the nearby Snake River.

## Day 3: Idaho Falls
In the morning, you might want to visit the nearby Yellowstone Bear World, where you can see a number of bears and other animals. You could also take a trip on the Snake River by boat or hire a bicycle to explore the city further.

## Day 4: Idaho Falls to Pocatello (130 miles)
On the journey to Pocatello, you could stop at the Massacre Rocks State Park, a historic site from the 1860s. In Pocatello, check in to the 'Thunderbird Motel', an accommodation that permits smoking at a rate of $63 per person per night.

## Day 5: Pocatello
On your first day in Pocatello, you may want to visit the Fort Hall Replica, a reconstruction of a 19th-century fur trading post. There's also the possibility of a visit to the Pocatello Zoo, which is home to over 100 species of animal.

## Day 6: Pocatello to Twin Falls (150 miles)
Make your way to the beautiful Shoshone Falls, which are taller than Niagara Falls and can be accessed via a short hike. You can then continue to the city of Twin Falls, where you can stay at the 'Blue Lakes Inn', a motel with smoking rooms that charges $57 per person per night.

## Day 7: Twin Falls
Consider spending your last day in Idaho visiting the Twin Falls Visitor Center, which offers information about the city's history, as well as access to the nearby Shoshone Falls Park and Snake River Canyon Trail.

## Estimated Budget for Accommodations: $326 per person

This 7-day trip allows you to explore the best of Idaho's cities and natural scenery, finishing with a final night in Twin Falls before your departure on the 10th.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
